name: stress
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: great worry caused by a difficult situation, or something that causes this condition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧张，压力；造成紧张的因素

example.eg: People under a lot of stress may experience headaches, minor pains, and sleeping difficulties.
example.egtrans: 压力大的人可能会出现头痛、轻微疼痛和睡眠障碍。

example.eg: Yoga is a very effective technique for combating stress.
example.egtrans: 练瑜伽是舒缓压力的非常有效的方法。

example.eg: the stresses and strains of the job

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way that a word or syllable is pronounced with greater force than other words in the same sentence or other syllables in the same word

example.eg: The meaning of a sentence often depends on stress and intonation.
example.egtrans: 句子的意思常常取决于重音和语调。

example.eg: When "insert" is a verb, the stress is on the second syllable, but when it is a noun, the stress is on the first syllable.
example.egtrans: Insert（插入）用作动词时重音在第二个音节上，但用作名词时重音在第一个音节上。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a force that acts in a way that often changes the shape of an object

example.eg: Computers work out the stresses that such a craft will encounter in flight.
example.egtrans: 计算机计算出诸如此类的飞行器在飞行中承受的压力。

example.eg: Jogging puts a lot of stress on your knee joints.
example.egtrans: 慢跑使膝关节承受很大的压力。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: During his speech, he laid particular stress on the freedom of the press.
example.egtrans: 他在讲话中特别强调了新闻自由。

name: stress
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give emphasis or special importance to something

example.eg: He is careful to stress (that) the laboratory's safety standards are the best in the country.
example.egtrans: 他谨慎地强调实验室的安全标准是全国最高的。

example.eg: I'd just like to stress the importance of neatness and politeness in this job.
example.egtrans: 我只想强调一下整洁和礼貌在这份工作中的重要性。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pronounce a word or syllable with greater force than other words in the same sentence or other syllables in the same word, or to play a musical note with greater force than others in a group

example.eg: In the word "engine" you should stress the first syllable.
example.egtrans: 在 engine 这个词中，应该重读第一个音节。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: Don't stress over it - we'll soon get it sorted out.
example.egtrans: 不用担心——我们很快会解决的。
